content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer).(For each problem, you need to first present three related but not identical problems, along with a description of each problem and its solution. Finally, provide the answer to the original problem in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ".)

Question: After standing up I had to sit right back down, why would I feel like this?
Options: A. train B. effort C. balance D. feet E. muscles

A. When I was on the train, I had to stand up to let an elderly person sit down. I felt like sitting back down because I was tired from standing for a long time.
B. I had to put in a lot of effort to move a heavy box. After standing up, I felt like sitting back down because I was exhausted from the hard work.
C. I was walking on a balance beam and had to stand up to maintain my balance. I felt like sitting back down because I was scared of falling off the beam.
D. I had been standing for a long time and my feet started to hurt. After standing up, I felt like sitting back down because my feet were sore and needed a break.

Therefore, the final answer is: E.

Question: After standing up I had to sit right back down, why would I feel like this?
Options: E. muscles D. feet C. balance B. effort A. train

E. I had been doing squats and when I stood up, my muscles were so sore that I had to sit right back down.
D. I had been standing for a long time and my feet were hurting so much that I had to sit right back down.
C. I was on a tightrope and when I stood up, I lost my balance and had to sit right back down.
B. I had been shoveling snow all day and when I stood up, I was so tired from the effort that I had to sit right back down.
A. I was on a crowded train and when I stood up, I realized there was no place to sit so I had to sit right back down.

Therefore, the final answer is: E.
